sn51.13:4.1: “Mendicants, if a mendicant depends on enthusiasm in order to get samādhi, get unification of mind,
sn51.13:4.2: this is called samādhi due to enthusiasm.
sn51.13:4.3: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that bad, unwholesome qualities don’t arise.
sn51.13:4.4: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that bad, unwholesome qualities that have arisen are given up.
sn51.13:4.5: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that wholesome qualities arise.
sn51.13:4.6: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that wholesome qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are fulfilled by development.
sn51.13:4.8: And so there is this enthusiasm, this samādhi due to enthusiasm, and these active endeavors.
sn51.13:4.9: This is called the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm, and active endeavor.
